headline: Clorox’s 5% Yield Dominates Consumer Staples: Can It Continue?
summary: The Clorox Company just paid investors $1.24 per share on February 13, 2026, marking the latest payment in a 48-year streak of consecutive dividend increases. But the Dividend King’s crown sits uneasily on a company navigating operational turbulence and margin pressure that raises questions about whether this 4.07% yield compensates investors for the risks ahead. ... Clorox’s 5% Yield Dominates Consumer Staples: Can It Continue?

headline: Pentair Just Paid Out: Is This Industrial Dividend Built to Last?
summary: Pentair plc (PNR) delivered its latest quarterly dividend of $0.27 per share on February 6, 2026, marking another milestone in a streak that now spans 50 consecutive years of annual dividend increases. At a current price of $102.08, the water treatment specialist offers a modest yield that reflects its growth-oriented profile rather than income maximization ... headline: Is JLL’s New MEA CEO Appointment a Subtle Recommitment to Its Tech-Led Real Estate Strategy?
summary: Jones Lang LaSalle has appointed Mouhammad Takieddin as Regional Head and CEO for the Middle East and Africa, based in Riyadh, to advance its presence in data centers, facilities management, and AI-driven real estate services across the region. This hire brings in 25 years of global real estate and facilities experience from Procter & Gamble, signaling a push toward digitally enabled, sustainability-focused real estate solutions across JLL’s Middle East and Africa platform. We’ll now assess...

headline: Colgate-Palmolive Dividend Scorecard: How Does the 2.6% Yield Stack Up?
summary: Colgate-Palmolive just sent $0.52 per share to investors that will land on February 13, 2026, marking another quarterly payment in the consumer goods giant’s 63-year dividend increase streak. That consistency places Colgate among an elite group of Dividend Aristocrats, but the real question for income investors is whether this 2.19% yield justifies the premium valuation—and ... Colgate-Palmolive Dividend Scorecard: How Does the 2.6% Yield Stack Up?

headline: P&G'S THE NATIVE BRAND LAUNCHES FEATURE-LENGTH "MICROSOAP" TITLED "THE GOLDEN PEAR AFFAIR" AVAILABLE ONLINE NOW, MARKING A NEW CHAPTER IN P&G'S LEGACY OF SOAP STORYTELLING
summary: Native, a clean beauty and personal care brand, P&G Studios, a division of Procter & Gamble, and dentsu Entertainment, a division of dentsu, today announced the ofﬁcial launch of The Golden Pear Affair the ﬁrst brand co-produced feature-length "microsoap" in the US. Produced by Pixie USA, and directors Kim Miller and Kristen Brancaccio, the microseries delivers a complete, cinematic story in bite-sized episodes designed for the vertical, mobile-ﬁrst era.

headline: P&G to Webcast Presentation From the Consumer Analyst Group of New York Conference, February 19
summary: CINCINNATI, February 12, 2026--Shailesh Jejurikar, President and Chief Executive Officer, Andre Schulten, Chief Financial Officer and Seth Cohen, Chief Information Officer of The Procter & Gamble Company (NYSE:PG) will be a featured speakers at the Consumer Analyst Group of New York Conference on Thursday, Feb. 19, 2026, at 9:00 a.m. ET.

headline: P&G Rallies Under New CEO but Lags Rivals, Faces Tariff Challenges
summary: Procter & Gamble (NYSE: PG) stock has climbed 11.65% year-to-date as of February 11, 2026, reaching $160 per share from a year-end close of $142.31. That gain looks impressive until you examine the broader consumer staples landscape. headline: Vetnique Labs Names Noel Geoffroy as Global CEO
summary: Vetnique Labs ("Vetnique"), a leading vet-recommended pet health and wellness company, today announced that consumer industry leader Noel Geoffroy has been named Global CEO, responsible for leading the global organization. Vetnique is backed by Gryphon Investors ("Gryphon"), a leading middle-market private investment firm.
